channel.title: Workspace 101: An introduction to TFS Workspaces
channel.description: One of the concepts that people need to understand when they begin to work with Team Foundation Server Version Control is that of the Team Foundation Server (TFS) Workspace. So I thought I would write a series of blog-posts covering...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Greg+00:00
item.description:
Great post... Thanks for taking the time to write this up and I'm looking forward to the reset in this series...
Thanks again.
item.dc:creator: Greg

item.title: Comment by quazy+00:00
item.description: Thanks for the intro to TFS workspaces. As a Java developer, I had been really confused it.
item.dc:creator: quazy

item.title: Comment by Hooman+00:00
item.description: Well done, nice and easy explanation
item.dc:creator: Hooman

item.title: Comment by Derek Greer+00:00
item.description:
"... if you un-mark a file as read/write, edit it and then do a "Get Latest" on that file then it will not be replaced ..."
I think you meant to say "... if you mark a file ..." (i.e. change a file from read-only to read-write).
item.dc:creator: Derek Greer
